com.xmlmind.ditac.convert

Class Converter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Converter

  • public class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the ditac command-line utility.

    This class has been designed in order to be easily embedded in any Java desktop or server-side application. Using this class involves:

    1. Creating an instance using the Converter(StyleSheetCache, Console) Constructor.
    2. Registering one or more XSL-FO processors with the newly created instance using registerXEP(java.lang.String), registerFOP(java.lang.String), registerAHF(java.lang.String), registerXFC(java.lang.String), registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String, com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Format, java.lang.String) or registerFOConverter(com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.FOConverter).
    3. Invoking run(java.lang.String[]) passing it an array of string arguments. These arguments are of course identical to those of the ditac command-line utility. These arguments are documented in XMLmind DITA Converter Manual.

    Note: This class is not thread-safe. Each thread must use its own instance. However the same instance may be run several times.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Converter()
      Equivalent to Converter(null, null).
      Converter(StyleSheetCache cache, Console c)
      Constructs a Converter using specified XSL stylesheet cache and specified console to display its progress, warning, error, etc, messages.

        public Converter()
        Equivalent to Converter(null, null).

      • Converter

        public Converter(StyleSheetCache cache,
                 Console c)
        Constructs a Converter using specified XSL stylesheet cache and specified console to display its progress, warning, error, etc, messages.
        Parameters:
        cache - the XSL stylesheet cache. May be null.
        c - the console. May be null.
        See Also:
        setStyleSheetCache(com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.StyleSheetCache), setConsole(com.xmlmind.util.Console)

      • setStyleSheetCache

        public void setStyleSheetCache(StyleSheetCache cache)
        Specifies the XSL stylesheet cache used by this converter.
        Parameters:
        cache - the XSL stylesheet cache; may be null, in which case a new {link StyleSheetCache} is automatically created
        See Also:
        getStyleSheetCache()

        Returns the XSL stylesheet cache used by this converter.

      • setConsole

        public void setConsole(Console c)
        Specifies the console on which messages issued during conversion are to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        c - the console; may be null, in which case messages are displayed on System.err and System.out
        See Also:
        getConsole()

        public boolean registerXEP(java.lang.String exeFileName)
        Convenience method: registers RenderX XEP with this converter.
        Parameters:
        exeFileName - the full path of the xep executable (xep.bat on Windows)
        See Also:
        registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String, com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Format, java.lang.String)

      • registerFOP

        public boolean registerFOP(java.lang.String exeFileName)
        Convenience method: registers Apache FOP with this converter.
        Parameters:
        exeFileName - the full path of the fop executable (fop.bat on Windows)
        See Also:
        registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String, com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Format, java.lang.String)

      • registerAHF

        public boolean registerAHF(java.lang.String exeFileName)
        Convenience method: registers Antenna House Formatter with this converter.
        Parameters:
        exeFileName - the full path of the AHFCmd executable (run.sh on platforms other than Windows).
        See Also:
        registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String, com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Format, java.lang.String)

      • registerXFC

        public boolean registerXFC(java.lang.String exeFileName)
        Convenience method: registers XMLmind XSL-FO Converter with this converter.
        Parameters:
        exeFileName - the full path of the fo2rtf (or fo2wml or fo2docx or fo2odt: it does not matter provided that all these scripts are found in the same directory) executable (fo2rtf.bat on Windows)
        See Also:
        registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String, com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.Format, java.lang.String)

      • registerExternalFOConverter

        public void registerExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String foProcName,
                                        Format targetFormat,
                                        java.lang.String command)
        Registers specified ExternalFOConverter with this converter.
        Parameters:
        foProcName - the name of the XSL-FO processor
        targetFormat - the format generated by the XSL-FO processor
        command - command to be executed to convert the XSL-FO input file to the output format
        See Also:
        registerFOConverter(com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.FOConverter)

      • getFOConverter

        public FOConverter getFOConverter(Format format)
        Returns the XSL-FO processor handling specified output format. Returns null if there is no such processor.

        Returns XSL-FO processor last registered for a given format.

      • setJhindexerExe

        public void setJhindexerExe(java.io.File exe)
        Specify the location of the jhindexer executable.

        Jhindexer creates a full-text search database used by the JavaHelp system full-text search engine to locate matches.

        Parameters:
        exe - the filename of the jhindexer executable, a script shell on Unix and a .bat file on Windows
        See Also:
        getJhindexerExe()

      • getJhindexerExe

        public java.io.File getJhindexerExe()
        Returns the location of the jhindexer executable. May return null.
        See Also:
        setJhindexerExe(java.io.File)

      • setHhcExe

        public void setHhcExe(java.io.File exe)
        Specify the location of hhc.exe.

        Hhc.exe is the HTML help compiler. It creates .chm files.

        Parameters:
        exe - the filename of hhc.exe
        See Also:
        getHhcExe()

      • getHhcExe

        public java.io.File getHhcExe()
        Returns the location of hhc.exe. May return null.
        See Also:
        setHhcExe(java.io.File)

      • run

        public int run(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes the conversion specified in array of arguments args.
        Parameters:
        args - same arguments as those supported by the ditac command-line utility. These arguments are documented in XMLmind DITA Converter Manual.
        Returns:
        0 if the conversion is successful; a value different from 0 otherwise. In the latter case, error messages are displayed on the console.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Implements the ditac command-line utility.
